author: Patrick Grafton-Green
title: Tributes to 'brilliant' former London councillor and blogger Daniel Hope after sudden death
text:
Friday 13 January 2017 14:20 BST Click to followThe Evening Standard Public servant: Former councillor-turned-blogger Daniel Hope 
Tributes have been paid to a “brilliant” former councillor and blogger from north London, who died following a serious illness. 
Friends learned of the death of Daniel Hope, who made it his life mission to ensure transparency in Barnet Council, at the age of just 44 on Wednesday. 
Mr Hope starting blogging when he stopped being a councillor in 2006, and would film every council meeting for his blog The Barnet Bugle. 
Around that time a number of competing bloggers also emerged, all in the hope of holding Barnet Council to account. So sad 2 hear of the untimely death of @barnetbugle Dan Hope. An honest highly intelligent politician & journalist who I will miss. RIP — Cllr Dr Devra Kay (@LaBloggeuse) January 12, 2017 
Close friend and Barnet councillor Mark Shooter told the Standard: “He was a quiet man, a very deep thinker, very firm in his views on politics and which direction the council should be going in. 
“He was a die-hard Conservative, spent his whole life promoting transparency in the council. 
“Barnet Council was his life. He came to every council meeting to film and upload them on his website. 
“He had a brilliant mind. I never met anyone so clued up not only on local politics but on the bigger picture.” Rest in peace Daniel. Will miss you. Baruch Dayan haemes @barnetbugle pic.twitter.com/2k1hRKe745 — Mark Shooter (@mshooter) January 13, 2017 
Mr Hope, a former chief whip who represented Brunswick Park from 2002 until 2006, also worked on the campaigns of former mayor Boris Johnson and Hendon MP Matthew Offord. 
His friend Lucy Nowell, who has been filming council meetings at Hendon Town Hall for the last four years, said: “Dan began filming months before I did, and there was some rivalry in getting our work published online. Shocked, devastated to hear of death of Daniel Hope, former Barnet cllr and man behind @barnetbugle . A mensch who was always fair and honest — Marcus Dysch (@MarcusDysch) January 12, 2017 
“But over the years, we ended up collaborating, and he would often use my council films when he couldn't make the meetings. 
“Dan was always very sociable, always had an opinion, and would happily spend the time after meetings chatting with councillors of all parties, often at the Greyhound pub in Hendon. 
“I will miss him, his sense of humour, and his insightful political knowledge.” So sad about death of Dan Hope @barnetbugle . We were in different political parties but worked together on anti-racism since mid 1990's — Jeremy Newmark (@Jeremy_Newmark) January 12, 2017 
Other Barnet bloggers also paid tribute. 
Not the Barnet Times, posted: “Daniel was the father of Barnet’s bloggers. 
“His legacy will be that he stood up for what he believed in, and would not be bullied into silence or submission, as were so many councillors seeking to climb the greasy pole of higher allowances.” More about:
